laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A depressed serum thyroid-stimulating hormone at <0.01 mIU/L and an elevated free thyroxine level at 4.3 ng/mL were later observed.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Severe global left ventricular systolic dysfunction with a left ventricular ejection fraction of 10% and mild left ventricular dilatation with an end-diastolic internal diameter of 5.4 cm.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Recovery of systolic function, with left ventricular ejection fraction of 60% recorded on repeat echocardiogram 1 month after initial presentation.
